results.title: r/Insurance on Reddit: Progressive "Renter Protection Policy" doesn't cover liability?
results.description: I have a tenant who left a faucet running. The water spilled out and damaged hardwood floors. My tenant has a Progressive "Renter Protection Policy", which includes liability. But.. excludes liability for a .. get this.. rented property. Excluded in a renters policy is: ""Property damage" to property rented to, occupied by, used by or in the care of an "insured".

results.title: Can a Landlord Require Renters Insurance? | Progressive
results.description: Learn more about personal liability coverage for renters. If your belongings are damaged or lost, for example, in a fire or burglary, your landlord won’t be responsible for replacing the items. But your personal property coverage may pay to repair or replace your belongings, up to your coverage limits. If your unit or rental home is damaged and becomes uninhabitable, your policy’s loss of use coverage may pay for you to live elsewhere while your residence is repaired or rebuilt—assuming the damage was due to a covered loss.
